intro: Erlangea milanjiensis, commonly known as the Milanjiensis erlanga, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand long periods of drought. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
